newsitem.title: ROMANIA: BUCHAREST BOURSE TO IMPROVE SETTLEMENT SYSTEM.
newsitem.headline: BUCHAREST BOURSE TO IMPROVE SETTLEMENT SYSTEM.

text.p: The Bucharest stock exchange said on Friday it aimed to present within a month an improved version of a system allowing custodians to take part in clearing and settlement of trades.
"New rules are being elaborated and they will be finalised and endorsed in up to four weeks," a bourse statement said.
Under the present system, custodians have control over shares but make settlements through private Bankcoop SA, the exchange's settlement bank, bourse official Adriana Tanasoiu told Reuters.
The improved system will allow them to become members of the custody system and make their own settlements for their clients, she added.
Equity market regulator CNVM said it had so far licensed four banks and a securities company to operate as custodians in Romania.
Tanasoiu said the Romanian subsidiary of Dutch ABN-AMRO was the first to act as custodian on the stock exchange, using the present system.
On Friday, ABN-AMRO said it had started operating as a custodian also on the over-the-counter market.
The Bucharest branch of Dutch ING Bank also announced it had won a CNVM licence to act as a custodian bank offering services for both equities and treasury bills.
The other two banks are Societe Generale and Romanian commercial bank Banca Transilvania.
Creditanstalt Securities SA, which operates as broker on Romania's stock exchange and OTC market, has also launched licensed custody services.
Custody services, a new product in Romania, were welcomed by bourse officials, brokers and analysts.
They say the new facilities minimising risks to investors' holdings would boost foreign investment and encourage big players to step into the market.
